basic_data.name: Best Tours - Chocolate Tour of Toronto

reviews.title: Delicious chocolate in all its glorious forms
text: We visited various chocolate stores and cafes, learned about the history of chocolate and its different types, and had an interesting walk along King St. W., Spadina Ave., and Kensington Market.  Ryan was our intelligent, knowledgeable, and outgoing guide.  What a great way to spend a Saturday afternoon!

reviews.title: Interesting variety, nice walk
text: Green-tea KitKats and Chocolate Basil gelato ending with delectable truffles.  The group never really gelled, and I would have liked more info about the neighborhoods through which we walked, but I never would have found these places or flavors on my own.

reviews.title: It's a scam! Do not book! Filing a complaint with consumer protection.
text: My story echoes every other 1 star review on this page. Simply stated, I booked two tickets for the chocolate tour, they confirmed day of, they cancelled after the tour had started, I asked for a refund and they keep giving me the run around. It's been two months and this company refuses to issue me a refund. They keep replying to my emails with generic language back. It's a total scam. Save your money. I hope this helps someone before they get scammed like I did. I am also filing a complaint with the consumer protection agency with the Government of Ontario. My email chain, along with the stories here, should get then shutdown hopefully.

reviews.title: Repeated Cancellations
text: To add our experience to batch of other similar stories, we booked a tour, had it cancelled with less than 24 hours notice, rebooked two additional times and had both cancelled. Now the company is telling us that the tour has been discontinued without a way of obtaining a refund since they did this a week or so after we could have received a credit with Living Social.

reviews.title: Chocolate Tour (or lack thereof) of Vancouver
text: My story is achingly similar to several of the others who have written. I purchased 6 of  the Best Tours "Chocolate Tour of Vancouver" as Christmas gifts. I booked a date in April, which was subsequently cancelled two weeks prior due to not enough participants. I sent a message asking how many people were required as I would happily round them up. I received no reply so re-booked the tour for May 27.

The day before I received a confirmation email and an hour prior on the day of I received a text and an email '"All Aboard BestTours.com! Your Chocolate Tour is on schedule ..." Good news as we were already on our way. We travelled to the meeting place and 15 minutes before the tour was to begin, I received another text saying all tours in the Vancouver area have been discontinued. ???? I would hazard a guess that decision was not made 15 minutes before our tour was to begin.

After a bit of back and forth where nothing was resolved, I also received a bunch of messages asking me to rate my tour and asking how likely would I be to recommend them. My answer to that is NEVER even if hell freezes over.
So instead we went on a beer tour and trashed Best (worst to be accurate) Tours.

reviews.title: Not BEST Tours but WORST Tours
text: This company is THE worst! I bought a Living Social deal for a chocolate tour in Vancouver. That was way back in October. Each time I attempted to book the tour was cancelled, sometimes at the last minute. Finally I booked a tour and it actually wasn't cancelled - so I thought! After driving 45 minutes one-way over a toll bridge we arrived at the designated meeting spot - early. Eventually 4 other girls showed up for the same tour. No tour guide showed up after standing there waiting forever. I texted the company asking where the tour guide was and that we were all waiting. No reply until hours later saying that the tour had been discontinued and to apply for a refund through the voucher company. Because the tour cancelled so many times, as it was bought ages ago, and had just expired there was no way for me to get a refund according to Living Social's cancelation policy. That is why 'Best' (aka Worse) Tours kept cancelling and then just before the voucher expires they don't cancel the tour but instead nobody shows up! Wow! These people are scammers!!! Stay far, far away from them!!  Unprofessional is an understatement!!

reviews.title: Do not book with this company!
text: We travelled 1.5 hours into Toronto for this tour. We were at the appointed site at the scheduled time but no one showed up. We called the support number but no one answered. We then called some of the establishments the tour was scheduled to visit. One was closed! Another one told us they had not confirmed that they would be bringing people and that they found them very unreliable and were cancelling their relationship with them! So we drove 1.5 hours, paid $15.00 to park and got no benefit. We ended up visiting Dufflet cakes on our own and enjoyed some treats. They then emailed me and asked how I enjoyed the tour!

reviews.title: They Cancelled Last Minute
text: Booked this tour as a birthday present. Had a hotel booked in Toronto for 3 of us, tickets to a dinner theater experience , and was on my way to the city on a bus when they sent an email to notify of a cancellation less than 24 hours in advance. Looking at the other reviews, this seems standard for them. Looks like there are lot of other tour companies with great reviews - stick with one of them.

reviews.title: NO SHOW WORST SERVICE
text: We received confirmation and drove over 2 hours and paid for parking downtown just to be left waiting for 20 minutes for someone to text us and say sorry cancelled. Worst service ever. Cannot believe the lack of service and organization. Now they send me a rate your tour experience. Are you kidding me? You did not provide a service and I want a refund. Awful.

reviews.title: No tour, no communication, no chocolate!
text: I purchased 4 tickets before Christmas for my daughters, sister-in-law, and myself through LivingSocial for a chocolate tour in Toronto provided by Best Tours.  We booked the tour for Saturday, Feb. 18.  A couple of days before the event, I received a reminder from Best Tours confirming the event.  On the Saturday, I received another communication from them confirming the event would be happening in one hour.  We arrived at the designated meeting place after driving into the city and finding/paying for parking.  There were about 20 other people also attending the tour that day.  A couple of people told us that their previous bookings for the tour had been cancelled at least once and sometimes a couple of times.  We were all excited to begin the tour.

The tour guide did not arrive at the designated time and no one texted us to say they would be late.  We sent a text to the number that had contacted us - no response.  Another person contacted Best Tours directly and was told that the guide would be late.  We continued to wait.  After about 30 minutes the person who was speaking with BT informed the group that the tour was cancelled because of the guide.  40 minutes later I received a text informing me that the tour had been cancelled - 40 minutes after it was supposed to start!!!

It doesn't end here.  We decided to contact a couple of the chocolate places listed on their web site to see if they had us booked and if we might be able to continue on our own.  Surprise, surprise.  The first place did not have the tour scheduled for this day and the second place said they did not work with Best Tours any longer.

The icing on the cake was when I received a text later on Saturday, after the event would have ended, asking us how likely we would be to recommend this tour and guide to a friend!  Lol  Are they serious?

We were all extremely upset and disappointed.  Best Tours provided the worst possible experience for everyone, with their lack of communication and no cancellation notification.  We wasted hours to travel downtown and money to park for a tour that we never received.
I would not ever recommend this company for a tour and would caution anyone considering purchasing a tour from them.

reviews.title: Chocolate Tour in Toronto
text: No show! Tour for June 5th at noon, no one showed up except my wife and myself. Had a nice chat with the TTC worker between him switching tracks for the streetcar though.

Iniated an online chat with best tours on my phone, told tour was cancelled due to low attendance. No email notifying us of the cancellation....all they wanted to do was reschedule. We just spent $46 for the GO from Burlington, who's repaying that?
Best Tours? BEST AVOIDED!

reviews.title: Could Not Contact to Verify so Cancelled
text: I booked the Italian food tour, due to the poor reviews here I tried to contact the company for two weeks before my tour. I never received an answer so  I cancelled through Groupon.  This is definitely more headache than it is worth.

reviews.title: Watch out! They cancelled our birthday plans
text: Watch our for Best Tours. They cancelled our chocolate tour booking for 10 people (for a birthday celebration) by sending us a boiler plate email with short notice saying it was canceled because of low numbers.

I couldn't get a hold of anyone when I called or submitted 2 messages (I eventually got a delayed response that was short and just said I had to pick another week (it was a birthday celebration!). I think the company is just a website and an automated phone/email system trying to make money across North America by taking advantage of those on Groupon and those who don't see all the horrific reviews on Trip Advisor (I'm guilty for not digging deeper).
If you want a real chocolate tour with real local people check out Tasty Tours. They salvaged our birthday plans and were amazing.

reviews.title: They keep cancelling on me -- Strike three, I'm out
text: I have tried to book the Italian Food Tour for three different Saturdays, in order to redeem four pre-paid tickets.   I even took time off work to be able to go.   The tour has been cancelled three different times.  I will be trying to get my money back.  Stay away.

reviews.title: Dessert tour
text: Getting to know new places for dessert it is always nice to see the variety that exists in Toronto. Five stops yummy taste and new experiences. Thank you to Forno cultura, delysées, dufflet pastries, dlish and nadége.

reviews.title: Tour cancelled twice - unreliable company
text: We booked a chocolate tour from Bestours for last Saturday which was confirmed, but then the next day cancelled. Then we booked a new tour for Sunday which was again confirmed and then received another email saying see you at the tour. We travelled a long way (we live out of town), got there 15 minutes early as the company requested and waited for 45 minutes while several other people joined the tour, anxious to get started. No tour guide showed up. Finally went online and did the online chat option to ask what was going on and found out that the tour was canceled. No one in the group had been notified in any form. Not not only did we travel a long way for it, other people did as well and there was also a couple from Ireland in the group who had been awake for 20 hours after traveling to Canada and came right to this tour, only to find out that it was canceled. This was a huge inconvenience and disappointment and very unprofessional of this company to cancel 2 tours and not even inform anyone of the economy cancellation. After emailing the company to find out what happened, we got a standard template response others have gotten that there were unforseen circumstances and these things are completely out of their control. Very unreliable company with poor customer service.

reviews.title: Is anyone surprised?
text: When 14 out of 23 reviews are in the "Terrible" category, one should figure out that this is a "stay-away" organization. Bought a Wagjag for my daughter-inlaw's birthday. She booked the tour for Saturday, April 15th and took three friends with her (travelling over an hour to get to Toronto) only to find out the chocolate tour had been cancelled. She called me and I immediately engaged in an online "chat" with someone from Best Tours. The insincerity of the apology nothwithstanding (stating that there are things "beyond their control) they then said I would have to take it up with Wagjag which  I intend to do this morning. I am encouraged when I see that someone who booked through Groupon got a refund. I can only hope.

reviews.title: Boo
text: First time cancelled. They don't answer their emails. Waste of time. Second attempt,  no show. Don't bother. Lucky us it was a gorgeous day and we did our own tour.

reviews.title: Poorly run company
text: Don't bother and save your time and money. I bought a Groupon for the Little Italy food tour. I booked, they confirmed the tour and then cancelled the day before. It took 3 weeks to get a response from the company. Rebooked again, same thing cancelled. At this point I contacted Groupon and received a credit for my voucher. Not worth the hassle - great idea in concept for something to do, but such a poorly run company, it's not worth it.

reviews.title: Don't waste your time and money
text: Very disappointed with the conduct of this company. The tour was cancelled because of lack of participants once, and two other times because of "guide emergency". We had to call to find out that the tour was cancelled two days before the scheduled date. If we hadn't contacted the company ourselves, we would have been waiting in the snow for the guide to never show. Don't waste your time and money.

reviews.title: Don't think is company is legitimate
text: I tried to book a tour three times with this company and each time it has been cancelled, sometimes with less than 24 hours notice.  They would not give me a refund and am waiting to see if groupon will or at least a credit.  This company seems like it is a scam as so many people heave tried to book tours but they have been cancelled due to low numbers that does not seem legitimate as people are buying these tours

reviews.title: Best Tours - Italian Tour
text: I can't help and agree with all the negative reviews. We also tried booking this tour with our Groupon but each time it was cancelled by Best Tours at the last minute due to 'low enrollment'.  Rebooking with them was also extremely inconvenient - terrible customer service.  Will never book with them again!  I was lucky Groupon provided a credit back to my account.

reviews.title: Disappointment at its best - be ready for 48-72 hour cancellations!
text: We were excited to book 2 tours (Taste of Italy / Chocolate Tour) with this company via Groupon. Thankfully, after 2 cancellations, Groupon was nice enough to get us our refund as we had 2 cancellations when we had planned to head to town for these events. While we planned to give it another chance in September, we just don't have time to waste on this. We'll be doing our own tour or finding another comapny.
It is extremely disappointing that companies like these exist and are allowed to cancel as they want. Do not put a deal on Groupon if you're unable to fulfill the end of your bargain.

We've had countless tours across Europe and in the USA and while only 2-4 of us showed up, they still went ahead. This company needs to learn before thinking of expanding or continuing their services.

reviews.title: Surprised they are still in business
text: If it seems to good to be true, buyer beware. I could have saved myself a lot of trouble by reading all the reviews before I purchased a Groupon for their tour. My experience was similar many others in that  my tour was cancelled at the last minute and the company did not respond to my requests to rebook. There are several other companies in Toronto who do offer good food tours and reliable service, so I don't know how this company is able to stay in business. Fortunately Groupon is very good about refunds to dissatisfied customers.

reviews.title: No show tour guide and non-existent customer service
text: We booked our date for the Italian tour months in advance, and two days before the tour I got a text that our tour was cancelled due to low numbers. This was inconvenient as I had someone coming from out of town for that day to do this. Rescheduled for another day, and went to the meeting spot. Another group of 4 was waiting too. After 10 mins of no tour guide showing up, we called and they told us it had been cancelled due to unforeseen circumstances (which I think they just made up). Neither myself or the other group got a text or email to inform us of the cancellation.

Asked to speak to a manager and the person on the phone told me that since its a weekend, there wasn't one and that a manager would contact me during the week. This did not happen and I just received a standard email to rescheduled. Tried to call again, and there is no way to talk to a representative during weekdays. Tried the online chat, and they just said sorry and that the manager "was in a meeting" and would contact me as soon as possible...which didn't happen. This company is a scam. Beware of the appealing groupon price.

reviews.title: Should be called Worst Tours!
text: We had booked 3 different tours through Best Tours for our weekend visit to Toronto. We planned one for each day: The Italian Food Tour on Friday evening, Coffee Tour on Saturday afternoon, and Chocolate Tour on Sunday.  As we were driving to Toronto on Thursday, I received a text message stating all 3 tours had been cancelled. Upon contacting them I was not able to resolve anything, we were just out of luck! I have to wonder if purchasing my tickets through Groupon, and not paying full price for the tickets had anything to do with it? After reading the other reviews here on TripAdvisor, I see I'm not alone... Wish I would have read these first... I could have booked activities through another tour group. On the bright side, Groupon did refund all 3 tickets, so at least we weren't out the $!

reviews.title: Italian Food Tour of Toronto
text: We were cancelled three times the day before due to low numbers. One of our party of 4 had cancelled appointments twice to go. Do not book this trip.

reviews.title: Chocolate tour no show.
text: Like others, we showed up yesterday at noon and there was no tour to be found.  I felt particularly bad for a couple of deaf tourists who also signed up.  What a waste of time.  I booked through Groupon and they gave me a credit right away.  I'm unsure why they still offer tours from this company.

reviews.title: Don't touch them.
text: I booked 6 months ago and wish I had looked for reviews. We had one booked for 3rd June. Wasted half an hour as no one turned up. Tried to phone and only got piped music. A later response to my email said "sorry for the inconvenience" and asked if I would like to reschedule, but gave no information haw to do so. I had no reponse to my next message.

reviews.title: Defintely got our money worth!
text: I was very surprised at how wonderful the tour was.  I purchased the tickets through Groupon and I got 4 tickets for the price of $60. Therefore it was $15 per person.

Since my sister and her husband were out of town I wanted to take them out on a different type of double date.  Our tour guide was very friendly, he always held door, and was very patient.  I disappointed that Soma was taken out of the tour but the other locations and the large samples more than made up for it. We were so stuffed we couldn't eat all of it and had to take some home!

We had the olive brownie cone from Forno Cultura, two macarons from Delysèes, brownies from Dufflet, nutella, red velvet & chocolate peanut butter cupcakes from Dlish, and pistachio chocolates from Nadège.
I recommend coming on an empty stomach, wearing comfortable shoes, and to bring some water on a hot day!

I really enjoyed the samples and the fact that even though I'm from Toronto and have been to some of those locations, I was introduced to new ones! My sister and her husband were amazed by the tour.  I would recommend anyone who is up for a walk to do it!

reviews.title: Best Tours is Horrible
text: I purchased a coffee tour with Best Tours through Living Social, and it has been a horrible experience. I have tried booking our tour 3 times, and it keeps getting canceled, I can't get in touch with anyone to help me with this, I have tried through email, phone, text and online chat (which they say is the best way to contact them). Really upset as this was supposed to be a bday gift and before I bought it I verified on their website that there was availability on the person's birthday weekend, and when they canceled, I was cool about it, and thought we could go the following weekend but they canceled that as well, and now they have canceled for this weekend. The person whose gift it is working weekends for the next few months so we won'e be able to use this, I want me money back.

reviews.title: Best Tours are the WORST
text: Do NOT book with this company, especially through Groupon. I lost my $40 in the end and never heard back from them except for generic emails. In summary, my tour was cancelled twice, Groupon refuses to refund me because "Best Tours" has my money already and the Best Tours customer service number is just an automated system that makes it impossible to reach anyone. So trust me and save your money!!

reviews.title: Brilliant!!!
text: It was Fab, the guide Bridget was fantastic, and really funny to boot- the shops were great aswell, the weather was absolutely freezing but hey what else do you expect in Toronto this time of year!!!

reviews.title: Great Value, great tour
text: I booked this tour through Groupon with two friends and had a fantastic time. We had only 10 days in Toronto whilst traveling and this tour proved to be an excellent tactic in getting to explore more about this wonderful city. The meet up spot was easy to find and our tour guide made the trip great fun. Loved the route they took us through and even revisited some of the spots after. Would definitely recommend.
Paul

reviews.title: Italian Food tour - non-existant
text: Should have read the reviews before booking.  Same deal as everyone else - three cancellations in a row.  When I asked (through their chat line) to rebook to ANY tour in Toronto, was told that no Toronto tours were actually running.  I do not think they actually run any tours at all.  Seems like a scam in hopes that people purchase vouchers and do not have enough patience to get a refund.

reviews.title: Don't bother - they don't even have tour guides
text: I bought a Groupon to try the Italian walking tour.  It was cancelled three times in a row.  I tried calling the customer support number on their site, but it's just an IVR without the option to actually talk with anyone.  When I contacted them through online chat, I was told that the reason the tours keep being cancelled is that they don't actually have a tour guide.  I'm not sure why accepting money and bookings for tours for which you have no tour guide is not considered a scam...my advice would be not to waste your money or time with this company,

reviews.title: Do not waste your time.
text: I booked a tour for a bachelorette event in August which was cancelled and I rescheduled it again for a birthday event. Again, it was cancelled, reason being that not enough people were attending the tour. I emailed customer service expressing my disappointment but they simply said I should contact Groupon for a refund. No apology or anything from them whatsoever.

reviews.title: A huge sugar high!
text: The meet up location was easy to find since it was on the corner of a huge intersection. Loved how the tour guide spoke a little about the history of the streets we were on and some background information about each stop. All the samples were full size and definitely bang for your buck (esp if you grab it off of Groupon). Cute date idea or for a girls day with chocolate lovers alike. Not full points because the tour does need to be rescheduled at times if they don't meet a minimum number and they don't let you know until the Wednesday or even the Friday before the tour.

reviews.title: No show, no customer service and had to jump through hoops to get a refund!
text: My husband daughter and I were so excited about the Chocolate Tour of the Fashion District in Toronto. We loved the description  of visiting bakeries and boutiques! We got to the meeting spot 45 minutes early and within a few minutes there was two other parties waiting with us. Has the meeting time passed and no one showed up to give us the tour three of us tried calling customer service to no answer. Finally one woman got an email stated that the tour was cancelled due to poor turn out!

reviews.title: Do Not Waste Your Time
text: DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME!

I purchased the Chocolate Tour through this company as a gift for a family member. After scheduling a tour date I received a text message the day before the tour addressing the need to cancel the tour and rebook for a future date. Unimpressed I was able to pick another date that fit everyones schedule and booked another tour. Now again I have received a text message two days before the tour explain it has yet again been cancelled. After reaching out to their Support Staff I was told it "might be" due to cancellation of guide members. I cannot express my frustration and the inconvenience caused by these constant cancellations. I do not trust this company and will not be recommending these services to anyone else. On top of that I now have to justify my reasoning for a refund. Completely unprofessional and inexcusable.
